alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 10:43AM EST until March 01 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Kankakee River at Dunns Bridge affecting Jasper and Porter Counties. Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Newton and Iroquois Counties. Kankakee River at Shelby affecting Lake IN and Newton Counties. For the Kankakee River...including Dunns Bridge, Shelby, Momence, Wilmington...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kankakee River at Dunns Bridge. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, flooding begins of low lying agricultural areas near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Tuesday was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.8 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: River rises are being affected by snow melt from a combination of precipitation and warm temperatures. Changes to the precipitation forecast or the temperature forecast may cause changes to the river forecast. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected around 345 AM CST late tonight.
